definitions.definition: Bound or obliged in law or equity; responsible; answerable.
definitions.example: 1748. David Hume. Enquiries concerning the human understanding and concerning the principles of moral. London: Oxford University Press, 1973. § 34.
A man liable to heart disease.

definitions.definition: Exposed to a certain contingency or causality, more or less probable.
(as predicate, with "to" and an infinitive) likely.
definitions.example: Someone is liable to slip on your icy sidewalk.
